text:
So time dilation. I have a physicist friend and we were engaging in some banter:

Me: How was your week
Them: Long
Me: But wasn't it seven days
Them: Time is relative
Me: But not to you


That's correct right?  Meaning the perception of a week (neuroscience aside) will always be the same because you're fixing the interval and observer

elements.text:
So time dilation. I have a physicist friend and we were engaging in some banter:

Me: How was your week
Them: Long
Me: But wasn't it seven days
Them: Time is relative
Me: But not to you


That's correct right?  Meaning the perception of a week (neuroscience aside) will always be the same because you're fixing the interval and observer

text: I think that it is important in which reference system you define the time interval.

elements.text: I think that it is important in which reference system you define the time interval.

text: it gets really messy when the reference frame is shifting around

elements.text: it gets really messy when the reference frame is shifting around

text: Yeah, you are thinking about what is called the proper time, which is what the watch of anyone shows to the one who wears it, and not what other observers see.

elements.text: Yeah, you are thinking about what is called the proper time, which is what the watch of anyone shows to the one who wears it, and not what other observers see.

text: depends on how fast the objects are moving really

elements.text: depends on how fast the objects are moving really

text: under normal conditions the difference between your week and someone elses(on Earths) should be very similar. Provided you all are at a similar altitude.

elements.text: under normal conditions the difference between your week and someone elses(on Earths) should be very similar. Provided you all are at a similar altitude.

text: basically the difference between reference frames is, on the human scale, negligeable unless travelling at a high velocity(near the speed of light), or spending prolonged periods of time(months) traveling very quickly.

elements.text: basically the difference between reference frames is, on the human scale, negligeable unless travelling at a high velocity(near the speed of light), or spending prolonged periods of time(months) traveling very quickly.
